fields.description:
Are you looking to make a difference in your community and the world? Are you interested in developing the skills and network necessary to do so?

The P2PU School of Social Innovation is a global, open source community for organizing peer study groups on topics like conflict resolution, project management for social innovators, and social innovation in education. SoSI is united by the common purpose of helping all people strengthen skills that are important for social innovators.

SoSI achieves this through free, peer-designed-and-directed study groups, which use a combination of online and offline project-based learning. The online platform allows study groups of a virtually unlimited size to access and remix high-quality open source curriculum, lectures and other resources for deepening theoretical understanding in international, collaborative teams, while participant-led offline citizen circles provide the opportunity for participants to work in their local context and to develop skills like empathy, resilience, and cooperation- skills which are often learned best through deeper practice, in person.

fields.description:
Mozilla and P2PU are creating School of Webcraft, a powerful new way to learn and teach web developer skills. Our goal is to offer learning opportunities and certification that help people build open web careers.

  • 100% free
  • Online and globally accessible
  • Peer-driven: learning is powered entirely by people like you.

Get involved!

  • Create a course or study group
  • Sign up for announcements
  • Join our discussion list
  • Follow the School of Webcraft web feed.

What can you learn at School of Webcraft?

Our content focus is on open standards-based web development:

  • Learn core development technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and jQuery.
  • Develop knowledge on User Experience, Accessibility, Security and more
  • Work with new standards such as HTML5 Video and Canvas
  • View the groups that are currently open for sign-up.
  • Want to learn other skills? Create a study group!

Open Badges: A new type of certification

Along with P2PU and Mozilla we're also developing an open badge system.

  • learners can submit work and earn badges to demonstrate their mastery of topics, skills and technologies
  • badges and assessments are endorsed by Mozilla
  • an awesome new way for learners to get public recognition of their achievements
  • use badges to build community reputation, get credits or even get jobs!

To find out more about badges view the Open Badges wiki pages.

Not an expert on your topic? Don't worry!

School of Webcraft staff and community members are here to help you learn:

  • We offer advice on relevant learning materials
  • Support you as you learn to facilitate and organise a group
  • Help you promote your group to other learners and topic experts
